description:
## Problem

prime.md line 38 says 'Priority: 1-5 (1=critical, 3=default, 5=backlog)' but code uses 0-4 (P0-P4) with default 2. command.go line 92 help text also says '1-5'. prime.md line 85 lists statuses as 'open, in_progress, closed' but omits 'deferred'.

Agents are getting wrong instructions from bw prime output.

## bd alignment

bd create --help says 'Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)'. Match this wording.

## Files to modify

- prompts/prime.md line 38: change to '0-4 (0=critical, 2=default, 4=backlog). Also accepts P0-P4'
- prompts/prime.md line 85: change to 'Statuses: open, in_progress, deferred, closed'
- cmd/bw/command.go lines 92, 131, 157: change --priority help text to 'Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)'

## Acceptance criteria

- [ ] bw prime output shows correct priority range 0-4 with correct default 2
- [ ] bw prime output lists all four statuses: open, in_progress, deferred, closed
- [ ] bw create --help shows 'Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)'
- [ ] bw list --help shows 'Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)'
- [ ] bw update --help shows 'Priority (0-4 or P0-P4, 0=highest)'
- [ ] No references to '1-5' priority range remain in docs or help text

## Test requirements

- Existing tests pass (go test ./...)
- Verify help output strings in prime_test.go and commands_test.go if applicable
title: Fix priority/status documentation
